name: Isaac's Carrot Cake
author: Kali Peacock
summary: A less-dense and wonderfully moist carrot cake with canned mandarin oranges rather than pineapple. A friend shared the recipe with me and I made it to celebrate the birth of my son (a birthday cake). It tastes best if you let it sit in the refrigerator overnight.
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Whisk flour, sugar, baking soda, ground cinnamon, salt, and nutmeg together in a bowl
Beat carrots, mandarin oranges, oil, eggs, vanilla extract, and orange zest into flour mixture with an electric mixer until batter is smooth, about 2 minutes
Pour batter into prepared baking dish
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean, 40 to 50 minutes
